metadata.title: CVE-2013-5642 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The SIP channel driver (channels/chan_sip.c) in Asterisk Open Source 1.8.xbefore 1.8.23.1, 10.x before 10.12.3, and 11.x before 11.5.1; CertifiedAsterisk 1.8.15 before 1.8.15-cert3 and 11.2 before 11.2-cert2; andAsterisk Digiumphones 10.x-digiumphones before 10.12.3-digiumphones allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference,segmentation fault, and daemon crash) via an invalid SDP that defines amedia description before the connection description in a SIP request.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-5642` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-config - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-dahdi - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mobile - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-modules - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mp3 - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mysql - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-vpb - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1').
